topic: Challenges Faced by International Students in Graphics & Multimedia
question: What are some challenges faced by international students in the Graphics & Multimedia program?
answer: The majority of students are local, and they often refuse to accept international students into their groups, believing that international students are lazy and do not work hard. Group work is crucial, especially in a major where project grades can sometimes outweigh final exam grades. There are very few international students in the cohort. Additionally, there are fewer sections for courses, and final exams are often scheduled on the last day of the finals period, with international students being the last to finish. Final Year Project (FYP) topics are mostly research-based, and the development involves fields and frameworks that students may never use again.

question: Is it necessary to register for Professional Skills Courses (PSC) this semester?
answer: If you have the opportunity to take a few courses, go ahead. Some courses are only available in the final year or semester. You can take one or two courses this semester and continue in the following semesters until you complete all five courses. There is no problem if you don't take any now; you can take them later, even in the 7th or 8th semester.
